page.title: 06WORK AND LEISURE IN HESSLE
page.content: A questionnaire to parents revealed that a number of fathers work outside Hull because of a lack of jobs in the area. Many mothers work part-time, either during the day or in the evenings. A few mothers work full-time. There are also a growing number of one-parent families. All these factors mean that leisure time is limited. Keep fit, jogging, walking, weight lifting and swimming at the local Sports Centre are popular pastimes. Some mothers go to keep-fit and aerobic classes.Squash and badminton are played by many at the Sports Centre.Few parents have unusual hobbies - the most common leisure activities include playing darts, pool or snooker;gardening;home and car maintenance. Several parents make their own wine, others breed birds or tropical fish; others race pigeons.
